text_content: If we look at these 10 protocols (and there are way more of them out there‚ÄîI just picked 10), this picture clearly shows that money in the crypto market is primarily generated through stablecoins! Next come perp DEXes, followed by staking and lending‚Äîmostly to borrow those same stablecoins!  I'll repeat a thought I voiced about two years ago: Blockchain as a phenomenon is great! But all we really need is a couple of networks and stablecoins! When we're talking about mass adoption, we just need the ability to use money for everyday transactions powered by simple blockchain technology!  And that's the core problem with altcoins right now: there are far too many projects that simply raise funds, allocate tokens to themselves and to cartels posing as participants in private rounds, then dump everything on the market‚Äîwhile showing you some random token unlock schedule chart‚Äîand the cycle repeats!  The only real use case that's genuinely impressed me over the past 5 years is the emergence of Hyperliquid. $HYPE

Hyperliquid $HYPE   Maintains Bearish Structure, $19 Support in Focus  Hyperliquid $HYPE  continues to trade within a bearish market structure, with price action signaling sustained downside risk. Despite short-term attempts to stabilize, the broader trend remains negative as sellers defend key resistance zones.  Market Structure Overview:  - $HYPE   continues to print lower highs and lower lows, confirming bearish dominance.  - Recent recovery attempts were rejected below major resistance, reinforcing downside bias.  - Momentum remains weak, suggesting limited bullish conviction at current levels.  Key Technical Levels:  Resistance: $28 A critical supply zone where prior rebounds have failed.  Support: $19 The next significant downside level, which may act as a liquidity and demand area if selling pressure persists.  Price Action Context:  After peaking earlier in the cycle, HYPE has undergone a prolonged corrective phase. The inability to reclaim former support levels has kept price structurally weak, with rallies increasingly sold into rather than extended.  Outlook:  Unless HYPE can break above resistance and invalidate the current bearish structure, downside continuation remains the higher-probability scenario. Market participants are closely monitoring the $19 region for potential stabilization or further breakdown signals.  Trend Bias: Bearish Short-Term Focus: Support reaction near $19   #Macro Insights#  #Altcoin Season#  #HyperLiquid  #HYPE

VIP MARKET UPDATE: $HYPE


$HYPE is pulling back after a strong rebound, but overall structure remains intact. Price is rotating into a clear support confluence where prior demand aligns with the rising trend base.


So far, selling pressure looks corrective rather than impulsive. As long as this zone holds, continuation remains favored. This area now decides whether buyers step back in or the market needs a deeper reset.

**$HYPE  (4H, BingX) üëÄ**  After a clean breakout and trend expansion, $HYPE  is now pulling back into a **healthy consolidation**. Price is printing **higher lows on the higher timeframe**, while the current move looks like a controlled retrace rather than a breakdown.  Key technical read: ‚Ä¢ **Trend:** Higher timeframe bullish, short-term cooling ‚Ä¢ **Resistance:** ~27.5‚Äì28.0 (recent rejection / local top) ‚Ä¢ **Support:** ~25.0‚Äì25.5 (key demand + MA confluence) ‚Ä¢ **MAs:** Price near the slower MA ‚Üí typical reset zone ‚Ä¢ **Price action:** No panic selling, volatility compressing  This is where trends often **decide**: continuation after digestion, or deeper retrace if support fails.  Is this the pause before the next leg‚Ä¶ or a larger range forming? üëÄ #HYPE  #CryptoTrading  #BingX

$HYPE /USDT BULLISH üöÄ  After testing the 25.80‚Äì25.70 support three times, the fourth move swept all retail liquidity below that level. Price is now holding above the support with strong bullish momentum, signaling a potential continuation toward higher levels.

Grayscale has officially registered for HYPE ETF 

If this proceeds, HYPE would be the youngest asset Grayscale has ever created an ETF/trust for.

Historically, Grayscale has been extremely conservative.. 
All previously listings were 3‚Äì10+ years old before Grayscale touched them.

HYPE breaks that pattern completely:
‚Ä¢ Live for ~1 year+
‚Ä¢ Still early-stage infra
‚Ä¢ No prior precedent inside Grayscale‚Äôs lineup

This matters because it likely means that: 
1) Grayscale views Hyperliquid as structural infrastructure, not just a token
2) They expect sustained volume + regulatory survivability
3) Internal conviction that HYPE ‚â† ‚Äúaltcoin risk bucket‚Äù

Grayscale does not take filings likely since their brand is built on credibility with institutions.

$HYPE   continues to trade within a clear¬†descending channel¬†on the daily chart, with lower highs persisting since September. Recent buying pressure defended the¬†$22‚Äì$24¬†support zone, triggering a short-term rebound, but price was quickly rejected near the channel midpoint.  The¬†28‚Äì$30¬†area remains a key resistance, as multiple recovery attempts have failed at this level. Meanwhile, the¬†RSI hovering in the high-40s¬†suggests consolidation rather than a bullish reversal.  Unless $HYPE   breaks decisively above the upper boundary of the descending channel, the current move is likely a¬†technical bounce, not a trend shift. - Colombian authorities are mandating crypto exchanges to submit user data 

- Trumps states that he have no plans to give a presidential pardon to FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried

If I had to choose only one perps airdrop to farm right now, it would be Extended

‚Ä¢ 30% of its token supply is confirmed to be airdropped at TGE
‚Ä¢ It is built by an ex-Revolut team
‚Ä¢ offers deep liquidity for most assets
‚Ä¢ Active traders earn 25-50% APR on their trading collateral
‚Ä¢ its TGE will happen in Q2
‚Ä¢ has a strong community, similar to Lighter and Hyperliquid in the early days
‚Ä¢ It's one of the fastest-growing perps DEXs by trading volume and TVL

The most interesting thing, in my opinion, about Extended is its market-making vault design.

When you deposit USDC into the Extended vault, you get vault shares (XVS tokens). XVS can then be used as collateral for trading and has a 5-15% base APR.

But on top of this, XVS holders earn an extra yield (up to 50% APR) based on their weekly trading activity.

This yield comes from Extended trading fees.

So you're actually getting a high double-digit yield on the funds you use for trading, while also earning points at the same time.

This seems like a great yield opportunity for stables, especially in the current market conditions.

If you wish to farm Extended, you can use my link for a 10% points boost + lower fees:
https://t.co/TCKgnspZBW

Both Hyperliquid and Lighter have done massive airdrops. I think there's a high chance that we'll continue to see big airdrops from perps DEXs.

Note: I wasn't compensated by the Extended team to write this post. I am covering it only because I believe its airdrop is worth farming.
